steps.title: Thaw the shrimp if they are frozen.
steps.content: Thaw the shrimp if they are frozen. Run the frozen shrimp under cold water for 5 minutes to thaw them. When the shrimp are thawed, they should bend easily and be slightly translucent. If the shrimp are fresh, you can skip this step. [1] X Research source Do not put the shrimp in the microwave to thaw them.

steps.title: Remove the shell if you have to devein the shrimp.
steps.content: Remove the shell if you have to devein the shrimp. If you have shrimp with veins still in them, you’ll need to remove them so that you don’t eat what was in the shrimp’s digestive tract. Use a pair of cooking scissors to make a vertical cut along the back of the shrimp's shell. Then, peel the shell away from the shrimp. [2] X Research source You can also remove the tail or leave it on, depending on your preference. Pinch the tail and pull to remove it by hand. You can also cut the tail off.

steps.title: Devein the shrimp if they aren't deveined.
steps.content: Devein the shrimp if they aren't deveined. Use a knife and cut a couple of centimeters into the back of the shrimp to reveal the intestinal vein. This vein will be black in appearance and usually runs down the back of the shrimp. Use your fingers or the knife to carefully pull up the dark black vein running along the back of the shrimp. [3] X Research source Some frozen shrimp come deveined in the package. The vein should lift up easily if you pull on it.

steps.title: Wash the shrimp under cold water.
steps.content: Wash the shrimp under cold water. Rinsing the shrimp removes dirt and bacteria. Once the shrimp are thoroughly rinsed, set them on a paper towel to drain until you’re ready to cook them. [4] X Research source Shrimp should always be kept on ice if you're storing them.

steps.title: Season the shrimp
steps.content: Season the shrimp . Put the shrimp into a bowl, sprinkle them with salt and pepper, and toss them so that they get equally covered by the spices. You can also add other spices to the shrimp including cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, or lime. Experiment with different combinations of spices to infuse different flavors into the shrimp. [5] X Research source Cumin and chili powder will add a spiciness to the shrimp. Fruit like lemon or lime add acidity to the shrimp.

steps.title: Heat 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of oil or butter in a saucepan.
steps.content: Heat 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of oil or butter in a saucepan. Use a pan that’s large enough to fit all of the shrimp that you want to cook. Put the oil or butter in the saucepan and turn on the stove to medium-high heat. Tip the pan so that the oil or butter covers the bottom of the pan. [6] X Research source Don't heat the oil or butter for too long or it will burn. Butter will turn brown when it burns, and oil will smoke and smell bad when it burns.

steps.title: Add the shrimp to the saucepan.
steps.content: Add the shrimp to the saucepan. Carefully drop the shrimp into the pan. They should sizzle when they hit the oil or butter. Move the shrimp into a single layer with a spatula or fork so that they all cook evenly. [7] X Research source Don’t drop the shrimp from high up in the air or the oil or butter may splash on you.

steps.title: Cook the shrimp for 4-5 minutes.
steps.content: Cook the shrimp for 4-5 minutes. Stir the shrimp with a mixing spoon as they cook. Turn the shrimp over halfway through cooking to ensure an even cook on both sides. When the shrimp are cooked, they should be pink and opaque. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Let the shrimp cool for 2-3 minutes and serve or store them.
steps.content: Let the shrimp cool for 2-3 minutes and serve or store them. Turn off the flame from your stovetop and empty the shrimp into a serving dish so that they stop cooking. You can store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Fill a large pot with enough water to cover all of the shrimp.
steps.content: Fill a large pot with enough water to cover all of the shrimp. Pour the water over the shrimp so that they are completely submerged. Once the pot is filled up, set it on top of your stove. The water should cover the shrimp 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm).

steps.title: Add salt and other seasonings to the water.
steps.content: Add salt and other seasonings to the water. Add a generous amount of salt to the water. You can also add other spices, like bay leaves, peppercorns, and garlic to impart more flavor in the shrimp. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Bring the water to a boil then reduce the heat.
steps.content: Bring the water to a boil then reduce the heat. Turn the stovetop to high heat and wait 10-15 minutes for the water to come to a rolling boil. Reduce the heat to medium on the stovetop once the water starts boiling. [11] X Research source Bubbles should still be breaking the surface of the water after you reduce the heat.

steps.title: Add the shrimp to the pot and cook them for 3 minutes.
steps.content: Add the shrimp to the pot and cook them for 3 minutes. Stir the shrimp with a spoon as they cook. The shrimp should start to turn pink and opaque after 2 or 3 minutes. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Transfer the cooked shrimp to an ice bath for 1-2 minutes.
steps.content: Transfer the cooked shrimp to an ice bath for 1-2 minutes. Prepare the ice bath by placing 5-10 ice cubes in a large bowl and filling it halfway up with water. Once the shrimp have cooked for 3 minutes, transfer them to an ice bath so that they don’t overcook and become tough. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Place the shrimp on a paper towel to dry.
steps.content: Place the shrimp on a paper towel to dry. Drape a paper towel on a plate and put the cooked shrimp on top of the paper towel for 2-3 minutes, or until they are dry. Then you can serve the shrimp or store them. [14] X Research source If you want to serve cold shrimp with cocktail sauce, place them in the refrigerator to cool. Boiled shrimp is often served chilled and served with cocktail sauce. You can also store the leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

steps.title: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C).
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C). Turn on your stove by pressing the up arrows or turning the dial to 400 °F (204 °C). Preheating the oven before you cook the jumbo shrimp will ensure an even cook. Move onto the next step as your oven preheats. An indicator light or sound should go off when your oven is preheated.

steps.title: Pour melted butter in a cooking tray.
steps.content: Pour melted butter in a cooking tray. Put a bowl of butter in the microwave for 5-10 seconds to melt the butter. Spread the melted butter into the bottom of a large, deep, cooking tray. [15] X Research source Melt enough so that you can coat the bottom of the tray in butter.

steps.title: Place the shrimp in the cooking tray.
steps.content: Place the shrimp in the cooking tray. Arrange the shrimp in a single layer so that they cook evenly. Stacking the shrimp on top of each other may throw off your cook times. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Season and toss the shrimp.
steps.content: Season and toss the shrimp. Use seasonings like salt, pepper, or garlic powder over the shrimp. Toss them well so that every shrimp gets covered by the seasonings. Experiment with different spice combinations to create different tasting jumbo shrimp dishes. [17] X Research source You can also add parmesan cheese, minced garlic, cumin, or onion powder to the top of your shrimp for extra flavor.

steps.title: Cook the shrimp in the oven for 10-12 minutes.
steps.content: Cook the shrimp in the oven for 10-12 minutes. Place the shrimp in the center rack of the oven and cook them. You’ll know when they are done because they will be firm and turn pink. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the shrimp from the oven and let them cool.
steps.content: Remove the shrimp from the oven and let them cool. Let the shrimp cool for 3-5 minutes before serving them. If you don't want to eat them immediately, you can store them in your refrigerator for up to 2 days. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
